title: Question 7
prompt: What is a line spectrograph used for?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.
A line spectrograph records light emitted by atoms. Each type of atom emits a unique pattern of light. When an electron loses energy, it emits a photon light) of a specific wavelength, depending on which level it jumps.
feedback: The diagram says that a line spectrograph detects photons of light from electron, so it shows information about electrons. The diagram also says, “Each type of atom emits a unique pattern of light.” Because the pattern of light for each kind of atom is unique, a line spectrograph will show an observer which type of atom is making the pattern. The line spectrograph is used to identify types of atoms by their electrons.
